dct_description_sm: California shown as a peninsula with very narrow northern attachment to mainland (nearly an island).
Map lacks all non-cartographic marginal details that appear in the final copperplate produced map.
Cartography may be derived from Covens & Mortier maps, and the decorations for the engraving from François Valentijn's Oud en Nieuw Oost-Indiën of 1726.
[Northwest passage] is shown cutting across the continent.
4 small hemispheres drawn in sheet corners show polar projections and eastern hemisphere.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
